title: Step Up your Home Security with this Google Nest Cam Deal!
description: It comes with support for 1080p footage and night vision. The post Step Up your Home Security with this Google Nest Cam Deal! appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: It comes with support for 1080p footage and night vision.
text: If you were looking to add a bit of muscle to your smart home security system, then you might want to check out this deal on the Google Nest Indoor Security Cam, which brings down its price to just below 70 bucks. The 2nd-gen Indoor Nest cam packs a ton of useful features, especially in a day and age where home security is all the more important. For starters, the Nest Cam packs built-in intelligence, allowing it to tell the difference between a person, animal, and vehicle. Users can check in from anywhere, and there’s also support for 1080p HDR video with night vision, and users can even rewind any events that they might have missed with up to three hours of event video history. It also works with smart displays, TVs, and tablets with Amazon Alexa. You can check it out using the link below. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
If you were looking to add a bit of muscle to your smart home security system, then you might want to check out this deal on the Google Nest Indoor Security Cam, which brings down its price to just below 70 bucks. The 2nd-gen Indoor Nest cam packs a ton of useful features, especially in a day and age where home security is all the more important.

For starters, the Nest Cam packs built-in intelligence, allowing it to tell the difference between a person, animal, and vehicle. Users can check in from anywhere, and there’s also support for 1080p HDR video with night vision, and users can even rewind any events that they might have missed with up to three hours of event video history. It also works with smart displays, TVs, and tablets with Amazon Alexa. You can check it out using the link below.
